content: I agree with @kayou and @StepBack13 so I've disabled reverse mode. I just had this in reverse mode and no one got 100%.
This contribution hasn‚Äôt received enough positive votes from the community. The "SHORTEST" option has therefore been deactivated.

I just had to do it in Reverse, and everybody got 0%, 
This is NOT a clash for Reverse or you have to improve the tests cases to make it understandable.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I loved this when I saw it so I will approve it since these critical thinking puzzles are what is needed in clash of code, I would remove reverse but it doesn't need to be removed unless it is confusing.

This was quite challenging, I didn't make it in due time, but it doesn't mean it is that necessarily hard! I was actually performing the permutation the other way around, but that is a mistake of mine, it was correctly explained in your instructions.
But this is a nice one, approved!

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: That was a nice challenge about permutations, pretty hard for a CaC but I think it is good to have hard ones too, so that it is not all about typing super fast without thinking!

I agree. It's too much in its current state, ESPECIALLY for reverse mode. That said, I think it could work with a few tweaks. My recommendations:

- Remove reverse mode.
- Explicitly mention that non-alphanumeric characters are stripped from the input before encoding and that the output is converted to uppercase.
- Better yet, don't include punctuation in the plain text messages, or include them in the encrypted output.
- Add another test between 1 and 2 that requires padding the end of the message with the beginning. With something as involved as this CoC, more tests are always good.
- Minor suggestion: separate the key into two numbers (the size of the blocks and the switching of characters). It gives more emphasis to the size of the block.

‚ùå Rejected the contribution.
Comment: I refuse this because it s hard introduction and complexity.

I like it, but real secret services won't use spaces in output, because it leaks the size of the key :)

solved it, python, ~4 minutes, with threee imbricated for() loops

Thank you! Congratulations for this impressive timing! 

(Btw, the real secret services will probably neither confirm nor deny your assumption... but would certainly pad the message with random characters üòâ)
Thank for the feedback. Do you think that without the padding scheme for the last block it would be easier ?

It's best to just disable Reverse.
I just got it in Reverse and only a bot got 100%, and the bot's code was clearly from a Shortest mode clash (was heavily golfed code).
Solving this in Reverse is way too hard.

I managed to get 25% because I got close to solving it, but I assumed the key would explain the opposite to what it does, I thought each value would mean the index to TAKE from the message in the order it should be output.

Expecting people to reverse engineer everything is just too much. Please disable Reverse.
